properties.name: Komodo Island
properties.description: Posted by TuskerIndonesia. Komodo IslandI filmed Komodo Dragons here in 2001 - although Komodo Island is the place most advertised as the realm of the dragons, they\'ve become accustomed to tourists and I\'m sure thats affected some of their instinctive behaviour. I recommend chartering a boat to nearby Rinca instead - its like stepping back into prehistory, with the dragons at their primordial best!

properties.name: Les Voiles de St Tropez
properties.description: Posted by AzuraliveAround Cannes, St Tropez in the Fall? The sight of over 200 sailboats swooping into the bay of St Tropez is stunning. Traditional wooden boats from the early 1900\'s, giant modern racing boats, agile slender sloops, all sails filled with wind move like swans in front of your eyes. If you visit, use the ferry boat from Sainte Maxime rather than drive to St Tropez where roads become "bouchons" or bottlenecks during major events or in the summer. PS - Les Voiles de St Tropez is happening this year from Oct 1 to Oct 8, 2006. AzurAlive

properties.name: Our place on the Mar Menor, Costa Calida Spain. You can rent it if you want.
properties.description: Posted by Happyholidaygirl  Our mega cool apartment is our 2nd home in a very sunny and still authentic part of the Costa Calida Spain. It is situated on the southern end of the Mar Menor (Little sea) and is nestled within the hills of the Calblanque Nature Park. It takes just a minute to walk to the beach by the blue lagoon of the Mar Menor sea. The apartment is in a quiet area. It has access to shared swimming pools (inside and outside), a east facing balcony, sea views, panoramic views, interesting views. If you are driving there is private parking and a garage. The apartment is right beside a beach and close to the apartment you will find sailing, water skiing, boat hire, wind surfing, shopping areas, restaurants and a food shop. The apartment comprises 2 bedrooms in total; 1 double, 1 twin. The property also has 1 double sofa bed located in the Living Room. This gives room for up to 6 people. Bed linen and towels are provided for your use. It also has 2 sets of patio furniture and 2 sun-loungers. The living room has a television dvd, satellite/cable. The dining room table and chair sits 4 people but 2 bar stools can be found in the kitchen. The kitchen caters for 6 people and has a microwave, fridge/freezer, washing machine, oven and hob etc. The bathroom has a shower, toilet, bath and bidet. 20 min from Murcia airport. 50 min from Alicante. This is a non-smoking apartment. Wheel chair friendly. Close to the apartment you will find Golf, sailing, water skiing, boat hire and boat trips, wind surfing, jet-skiing, fishing, walking, cycling, mountain biking, horse riding, skiing/snowboarding, golf, tennis, a sports center, scuba diving, Quad-biking, shopping areas, a restaurant, a food shop. Further afield are Cartagena Calblaque Rio safari. Aqualandia Waterpark. Terra Mitica Theme Park. Great shopping too!!

properties.name: Silver Springs
properties.description: Posted by UrbandragonOne of Florida\'s first tourist attractions, the springs have attracted visitors since pre-european days. A destination for tourists since the 1890s, the glass bottom boats still take visitors through the springs and down the Silver River. Many Hollywood productions have been filmed here, including the Creature from the Black Lagoon, Thunderball, and the Sea Hunt TV show. There is also a small zoo with Florida animals as well as Kodiak bears, when you take the boat trip down the Silver River you can also see monkeys that were released to the area accidentally after a former owner thought it would make a nice attraction for visitors - he put the monkeys on an island, not realizing they could swim. This was in the 30s, they\'re living in the Ocala National Forest to this day. Definitely worth a stop, it\'s an important part of Florida history.

properties.name: Slept on a Boat in Stockholm
properties.description: Posted by CameronstockholmWent to Stockholm on a whim while we were in Europe last. I had gone through briefly 10 years previous on the way to Jorpeland, Norway via Oslo and Stavanger. We had no idea where we were going to stay that night so we wandered through old downtown and down the river to a now non-seaworthy boat that has been converted into a very cool hotel/hostel. After checking in we went back into downtown and ate Swedish Fish in a public square where there was a weird "Man on the Street" Diet Coke promotion. There were two Uber-hip looking Swedes at a table with like, thousands of cans of Coke. One of them was yelling "Free Diet Coke!" in Swedish while the other was opening cans at hyper speed and handing them out. Back at the Boat-el I discovered that the showers were just like, wide open with the rest of the bathroom. Sinks on one side of the room and showers on the other with no curtains or anything. No big deal except that if a shower is on everything gets wet. It\'s almost like there\'s just sinks in the shower room or somehting. So I take a shower at about 11:00pm and there\'s this Ultrahighfashion Italian dude in there brushing his teeth getting ready for a night on the town trying not to get sprayed from the shower!

properties.name: West Coast Trailor Sailing Squadron
properties.description: Posted by Billcanoe http://members.ij.net/wctss/wctss/index.htm The West Coast Trailer Sailing Squadron is a community of sailing friends. We gather together as a fleet once or twice per month, to cruise or daysail together. The WCTSS is not an official yacht club of any sort. It is just a way for people who love small sailboats to sail together, share experiences, and make new friends. When participating in our outings all risks are assumed by you. You should only participate in our daysails or cruises if you have the experience to sail your vessel safely, and have a seaworthy vessel.
